alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 10:32AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Armstrong, Randall, southeastern Deaf Smith and southeastern Potter Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1031 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Umbarger, or 10 miles west of Canyon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Umbarger, Palo Duro Canyon, and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall
